trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_SEQ_00<tab>Wuk Lamat settles down to rest before the festival gets underway.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Wuk Lamat.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_TODO_01<tab>Survey the designated area and defeat any hostile wildlife.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_TODO_02<tab>Survey the next designated area and defeat any hostile wildlife.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_TODO_03<tab>Survey a third designated area and defeat any hostile wildlife.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_TODO_04<tab>Wait at the designated location.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_TODO_05<tab>Speak with Linuhanu.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_001<tab>As Wuk Evu said, the festival really is a spectacle to behold.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_KRILE_000_002<tab>I'm excited to see how Ihih'hana turns out!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_005<tab>We should get some rest before the excitement begins...
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_HANUHANUMALE04869_000_006<tab>Over there, by the float─isn't that the Third Promise? Then the rumors are true. She's trying to complete the Feat of Reeds by reviving Ihih'hana.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_HANUHANUFAMALE04869_000_007<tab>The festival <var 1A 02 /var>is<var 1A 01 /var> a prayer for healthy crops, but does she honestly believe that will be enough to save our harvest?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_HANUHANUFAMALE04869_000_008<tab>The Second Promise, meanwhile, barely glanced at the fields before leaving Ok'hanu altogether. Maybe we asked too much of our young claimants...
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_HANUHANUMALE04869_000_009<tab>Oh, I wouldn't be too quick to count Koana out. A friend of mine overheard him muttering by the reeds. Something about what “needs to be done.”
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_HANUHANUFAMALE04869_000_010<tab>Is that so!? Perhaps we'll get to see another of his innovations firsthand.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_011<tab>Heh, that sounds like our Koana. One look at the reeds was all he needed to think up a solution...
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_012<tab>Be that as it may, our own solution is nearly ready.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_013<tab>Indeed! As soon as the others get back, our long-awaited festival can begin!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_014<tab>It took some doing, but we managed to gather competitors to vie for the title of Wind's Chosen. The winner was only too happy to donate his feathers.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALISAIE_000_015<tab>You should've seen it! He called forth an incredible gust that sent his feather sailing for malms!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALISAIE_000_016<tab>We had a turn ourselves, but it's more difficult than it looks. Poor Erenville's twirled in the air for a moment before landing on his foot...
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ERENVILLE_000_017<tab>I am a gleaner. Magic is not part of our training.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_KRILE_000_018<tab>As for us, we've brought the wood and gemstone replacements crafted by Wuk Evu. All that's left is to attach them.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKEVU_000_019<tab>Has it been decided who will ride the float?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_020<tab>Papa was the guest of honor the last time I was here. I remember being surprised they could even lift the thing with his hulking weight on top of it.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_021<tab>The rider must be a personage of great esteem, which is why an invitation is usually extended to the Dawnservant. This time, however, I have another in mind.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_022<tab>Oh, who is it?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_023<tab>Our beloved Ihih'hana, the Lifting of Wings, is only being held because of you and your companions. Thus do I nominate you, Wuk Lamat, as our guest of honor.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_024<tab>Huh? Me!?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_025<tab>...This boat won't make me seasick, will it?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_026<tab>I...don't think so?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_027<tab>Then weigh anchor! I can hardly refuse a request from one even more enthusiastic about the festival than me!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_028<tab>I would be delighted to ride your float!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_029<tab>Thank you, Wuk Lamat.

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_030<tab>I have roles for the rest of you as well. We'll be carrying the festival float in a slow procession towards Kozanuakiy, where the sacred likeness of Kixaihih is ensconced.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_031<tab>What I'd like you to do is clear the path of dangerous wildlife, so that the procession can move along unimpeded.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_032<tab>Consider it done.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_033<tab>You expect me to sit still until Wuk Evu has finished with the float? Let me come along and help with the clearing!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ERENVILLE_000_034<tab>As you know, I'm not much for fighting. I'll stay behind and assist Wuk Evu with the repairs.

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_035<tab>If you aren't sure where you need to go, the path I spoke of begins at the south of the village and branches off to the east. That will lead you across the bridges to the Stride of the Sun.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_036<tab>Then we shall see to clearing it end to end.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ERENVILLE_000_040<tab>With my lack of combat skills, I would only get underfoot. Happy hunting.

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_045<tab>The Ihih'hana procession often runs afoul of territorial creatures on the way to Kozanuakiy. I would greatly appreciate you removing those threats in advance.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKEVU_000_050<tab>I'll get to work. By the time you're done mashing monsters, the float will be good as new.

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_055<tab>If the float functions as I think it does, I would not be surprised if it were attracting the creatures. The concentration of aether would be an irresistible lure.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALISAIE_000_060<tab>Weapons at the ready! We'll make short work of this task!

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_KRILE_000_065<tab>The degree to which Wuk Evu pursues his interests is remarkable. Apparently his studies of the Kozama'uka region were so invigorating that he decided to move here and immerse himself in the culture.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_070<tab>As Linuhanu said, Kozanuakiy should be down this way, then off to the east when the path branches. Then something about bridges and the Stride of the Sun...?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_071<tab>Anyway, let's split up and get to work. Once you've culled all the threats you can find, we'll meet up in front of Kixaihih!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_080<tab>Hah! That's one down!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALISAIE_000_085<tab>Now this is my kind of busywork!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_KRILE_000_090<tab>I told you, you don't need to watch over me anymore.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_095<tab>At this rate, we'll soon have the route to Kozanuakiy secured.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_120<tab>Ah, you were a step ahead of us.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_121<tab>This must be the likeness of Kixaihih.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_122<tab>The Hanuhanu deity of the harvest.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_A1_000_001<tab>Even their sacred images are woven with reeds.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_A1_000_002<tab>I was half expecting a flying whale...
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_A1_000_003<tab>It reminds me of something I saw in Akadaemia Anyder...

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_124<tab>Makes you appreciate how much their culture revolves around the reed harvest, doesn't it? It's said that Kixaihih was worshipped on another continent. This ancient faith was then brought to Tural by the first Hanuhanu.

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_125<tab>A whale? Why a whale of all things...? Anyway, it's said that Kixaihih here was worshipped on another continent. This ancient faith was then brought to Tural by the first Hanuhanu.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_126<tab>One of the ancients' creations?

TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_127<tab>'Tis possible a vestigial memory of that time endured. A subconscious recollection from the inheriting soul providing the basis for an entirely new religion.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_128<tab>I...have no idea what that means.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_129<tab>As far as I know, Kixaihih was worshipped on another continent. This ancient faith was then brought to Tural by the first Hanuhanu.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_130<tab>The Hanu migrated here from another continent? Then mayhap the two <var 1A 02 /var>do<var 1A 01 /var> share a common ancestor...
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALISAIE_000_131<tab>This is all very fascinating, but shouldn't we be getting back to Linuhanu? He'll want to know the path is safe for the procession.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_132<tab>Right, and I need to ride on the float! I'll run ahead and tell him we're done here!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_140<tab>I'm glad we kept the float out of Bakool Ja Ja's clutches, but gods... He brushed me aside like I was a bothersome gnat.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ERENVILLE_000_145<tab>A tense encounter. I'm thankful Alphinaud thought to share those linkpearls.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_KRILE_000_150<tab>I'm thankful we made it back before anyone was seriously injured.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALPHINAUD_000_155<tab>Given the nature of the rite of succession, I expect such altercations are inevitable.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_ALISAIE_000_160<tab>He waited for us to leave so he could steal the float. A coward <var 1A 02 /var>and<var 1A 01 /var> a thief!
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKEVU_000_165<tab>If I've learned one thing in my life, it's that poor manners often betray poor character.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_170<tab>Thank you for coming to our rescue.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_LINUHANU_000_171<tab>I tried to protect the float, but against that two-head... I may as well have not been there at all.
TEXT_KINGMA110_04869_WUKLAMAT_000_172<tab>Nonsense! You stood your ground and bought us the time we needed to make it back. You were incredibly brave!
